img_above_text:
![Breath Of Fire .jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/0/0d/Breath_Of_Fire_.jpg)| Breath Of Fire| Epic | Using the gourd significantly increases attack for the next Unveiling Strike in Cloud Step for a short duration | Defeat Cyan Loong in Bitter Lake - Turtle Island (secret boss) in The New West (requires Loong Scales) | Breath Of Fire
![Black-myth-wukong-turtle-tear.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/1/1e/Black-myth-wukong-turtle-tear.jpg)| Turtle Tear| Epic | When at full Health, using the gourd recovers a moderate amount of Mana | Found in North Shore of the Bitter Lake at Bitter Lake in The New West, along the right side of the shore Interact with the skeleton at the back of the area to spawn the Soak back on the shoreline | Turtle Tear
img_below_text:
![Black-myth-wukong-steel-ginseng.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/5/57/Black-myth-wukong-steel-ginseng.jpg)| Steel Ginseng| Rare | Using the gourd, instantly gains a moderate amount of Focus | Randomly obtained from Aged Ginseng plants | Steel Ginseng
![Black-myth-wukong-sweet-ice.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/5/58/Black-myth-wukong-sweet-ice.jpg)| Sweet Ice| Uncommon | Using the gourd moderately increases Chill Resistance for a short duration | Found in New Thunderclap Temple, Temple Entrance in The New WestFollow the path towards the right and ahead and through the red gate Continue ahead and to the right through another red gate and up the stairs Take another right and look under a gazebo to find the Soak | Sweet Ice
summary_promot:
You are shown an image extracted from a video game walkthrough or guide.


        
        Context:
        - Preceding Text: "![Breath Of Fire .jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/0/0d/Breath_Of_Fire_.jpg)| Breath Of Fire| Epic | Using the gourd significantly increases attack for the next Unveiling Strike in Cloud Step for a short duration | Defeat Cyan Loong in Bitter Lake - Turtle Island (secret boss) in The New West (requires Loong Scales) | Breath Of Fire
![Black-myth-wukong-turtle-tear.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/1/1e/Black-myth-wukong-turtle-tear.jpg)| Turtle Tear| Epic | When at full Health, using the gourd recovers a moderate amount of Mana | Found in North Shore of the Bitter Lake at Bitter Lake in The New West, along the right side of the shore Interact with the skeleton at the back of the area to spawn the Soak back on the shoreline | Turtle Tear"
        - Following Text: "![Black-myth-wukong-steel-ginseng.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/5/57/Black-myth-wukong-steel-ginseng.jpg)| Steel Ginseng| Rare | Using the gourd, instantly gains a moderate amount of Focus | Randomly obtained from Aged Ginseng plants | Steel Ginseng
![Black-myth-wukong-sweet-ice.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/5/58/Black-myth-wukong-sweet-ice.jpg)| Sweet Ice| Uncommon | Using the gourd moderately increases Chill Resistance for a short duration | Found in New Thunderclap Temple, Temple Entrance in The New WestFollow the path towards the right and ahead and through the red gate Continue ahead and to the right through another red gate and up the stairs Take another right and look under a gazebo to find the Soak | Sweet Ice"

        Your task:
        1. Generate a **short, clear, and informative English summary** of the image.
        2. Focus primarily on the **preceding and following text** to infer the image's **purpose, content, or narrative role**.
        3. Do **not** speculate beyond the visible content.
img_summary: The image depicts the "Steel Ginseng," a rare item from the video game *Black Myth: Wukong*. This item is associated with the gourd mechanic and provides the effect of instantly gaining a moderate amount of Focus when used. According to the surrounding text, it can be randomly obtained from Aged Ginseng plants. The item's design reflects its in-game rarity and utility.
